label: 愛染王, 愛染明王
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
見出し読み: あいぜんおう, あいぜんみょうおう
見出し読み_mod: あいぜんおう, あいぜんみょうおう
説明文: 愛染（明）王, also referred to as Zen'ai-ō (染愛王).  This deity, Rāga, is the patron of love, and was thus approached by esoteric Buddhists in Japan primarily for the acquisition of another's affection or safe childbirth from the 11th century on.  At the same time, he could also be approached for the purpose of overcoming one's enemies.  He was also thought to possess a wish-fulfilling jewel in one of his hands, and was sometimes approached through veneration of the jewel in the form produced in esoteric Buddhism, a rite usually called nyohō aizen hō (如法愛染法).
